author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs
Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 17th March 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:39 - Entry of the bible and lighting of the peace candle
07:57 - Welcome and explanation of worship today
10:38 - Share at your table - something you are grateful for, from the week past
Gathering and opening prayer Glorify the LORD with me; let us exalt God’s name together. It is good to give thanks to the Lord For God’s love endures for ever
16:59 - Praise Songs led by worship band MP 1259 Bless the Lord of my soul MP 465 Meekness and majesty MP 1003 My Jesus, my Saviour
28:10 - Prayer and Lord’s Prayer
29:21 - Introducing the reading
30:20 - 31:00 - Reading John 12:20-22 NIVUK read by Nathanael Bello 20 Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the festival. 21 They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, with a request. ‘Sir,’ they said, ‘we would like to see Jesus.’ 22 Philip went to tell Andrew; Andrew and Philip in turn told Jesus.
31:11 - 37:47 - Talk: ‘Wanting to see’
Question 1: How do we help people to ‘see’ Jesus? 38:11 - Prayers with Song TP 74 Open our eyes we want to see Jesus (x 2)
40:04 - Seeing Jesus in each other – coffee served at the tables
53:02 - 54:50 - Reading John 12:22-33 read by Harri Bello 23 Jesus replied, ‘The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified. 24 Very truly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains only a single seed. But if it dies, it produces many seeds. 25 Anyone who loves their life will lose it, while anyone who hates their life in this world will keep it for eternal life. 26 Whoever serves me must follow me; and where I am, my servant also will be. My Father will honour the one who serves me. 27 ‘Now my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? “Father, save me from this hour”? No, it was for this very reason I came to this hour. 28 Father, glorify your name!’ Then a voice came from heaven, ‘I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.’ 29 The crowd that was there and heard it said it had thundered; others said an angel had spoken to him. 30 Jesus said, ‘This voice was for your benefit, not mine. 31 Now is the time for judgment on this world; now the prince of this world will be driven out. 32 And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.’ 33 He said this to show the kind of death he was going to die.
55:57 - Question 2: What does this reading tell us about the death of Jesus?
56:07 - 01:00:52 - Talk: ‘the One and the many’
01:01:22 - 01:02:53 - Reading: ‘One Solitary Life’
01:03:23 - 01:05:03 - Song TP 102 You laid aside your majesty
01:05:10 - Question 3: how might we glorify God’s name today?
01:05:26 - 01:10:40 - Prayers for ourselves and the world with response Song R&S 375 In my life Lord be glorified
01:10:47 - Activity at tables – sow a seed Spend a few moments quietly thinking about how the seed must ‘die’ (split open and shrivel up) in order for new growth to come.
Then we offer this prayer: 01:21:50 - Lord, you have sown the seed of your love in our hearts. May we welcome and nurture your love. Calm our fears and make our prejudices fade away and die. May we welcome and nurture your love. Help us to open our hearts and our arms to others. May we welcome and nurture your love. Loving Lord, keep us in your love. May we welcome and nurture your love, now and for ever. Amen.
01:22:33 - 01:26:33 - Hymn R&S 289 To God be the glory
01:26:34 - 01:26:49 - The grace
01:27:08 - 01:30:14 - Music after the service
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications 🔔 when we post new services. - Like our services ❤️ or leave a comment on your favourite ones. 🙏 - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. 🔄

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 10th March 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:04 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
07:21 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
08:49 - Call to worship - Psalm 63: vs 1-5 - we say together
10:04 - Hymn MP 712 Turn your eyes upon Jesus (chorus only x2)
11:54 - Hymn MP 454 Majesty, worship his majesty
14:34 - Hymn MP 1076 Jesus be the centre
16:57 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
19:54 - 24:22 - All age talk: “Mother’s day” We've all got mothers, even if we don't have them anymore. Empathy is understanding what someone is going through. As mothers, you also multitask, are flexible when plans change, nurse injured children, and more. We try to remind those mothers that they have gifts they don't realize - organization, timekeeping, cooking, cleaning - a mother is special. Maybe some of you didn't have such an easy mother. Some feel neglected. But a mother's job is so difficult. We thank God for the gifts to be good parents and grandparents, for the teachings to guide and empower us. Today, let's pray for struggling mothers - financial issues, difficult relationships or single parents.
24:25 - Blessing as Junior Church go to their activities: Adults: May the Lord be with you Junior Church: And also with you All: Amen
25:01 - 27:11 - Old Testament Reading: Psalm 145
28:50 - 23:27 - Hymn. MP 1350 Speak o Lord
33:10 - 34:42 - New Testament Reading: 2 Peter 1: 1 – 11
34:50 - 58:42 - Sermon “God’s Divine Power and His Precious Promises" Do you to know God's abundant grace and peace through truly knowing Him, not just biblical knowledge. Do you regularly talk to Him and give Him your problems? God says He has given you everything you need for life and godliness through His divine power. Do you believe that, even for areas you struggle with? When you became a Christian, God's Holy Spirit came to live in you, giving you access to all God's power and resources. Do you realize what that means? Don't just try to change in your own strength. Give your problems fully to God, and let His Spirit empower you. I had to do that for worrying. For even small decisions, ask God which way He wants you to go. He may have purposes you don't realize by choosing one way over another. God has given us very great and precious promises to participate in His divine nature. Read and claim His promises for your life. Make every effort to add virtue, knowledge, self-control, perseverance, godliness, kindness and love to the faith God gave you. If you lack these, you become ineffective and unproductive, forgetting you've been cleansed from sin. Don't let that happen! Therefore, confirm your calling. If you cultivate these qualities, you'll never stumble and receive a rich welcome into Christ's eternal Kingdom.
A time of quiet reflection
58:59 - 01:03:01- Hymn. R&S 92 Amazing Grace”
01:03:21 - 01:07:07 - Prayers for others and ourselves We pray for those places in strife - Israel and Palestine, Russia and Ukraine, Yemen, many places in Africa, the Middle East.
01:07:42 - 01:11:12 - Hymn. R&S 489 Be thou my vision”
01:13:37 - 01:14:04 - Closing blessing.
01:14:34 - 01:20:28 - Music after the service
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome

media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:06 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
08:43 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
09:29 - Call to worship (from Psalm 19)
09:58 - 12:00 - Hymn Let all the world (Tune: Luckington)
12:39 - Prayer of approach
14:18 - 22:53 - Introduction for all ages: ‘remember the rules’
23:21 - 26:17 - Hymn A new commandment (sung twice)

30:33 - Prayer of confession and assurance of pardon
32:44 - 34:05 - Reading: John 2.13-22 NIVUK read by Valerie
34:29 - Hymn - As the deer pants
37:42 - 50:45 - Address: ‘Breaking the rules?’
51:16 - 53:45 - Time of silence and prayers of intercession
53:59 - 56:49 - Hymn Jesus calls us here to meet him
56:55 - Invitation and Thanksgiving Prayer

01:06:28 - Hymn Guide me, O thou great Jehovah
01:09:23 - 01:09:49 - Blessing

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 25th February 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
04:29 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
04:59 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
06:25 - Call to worship: taken from Mark 8:34
07:15 - Hymn: R&S 107 The love of God comes close, tune: Rhosymedre
11:31 - Opening prayers of Approach, Confession & Thanksgiving
16:55 - The Lord’s Prayer (modern version)
WE LISTEN FOR GOD’S WORD 17:38 - 20:49 - Reading: Mark 8:31-38 read by John Hillson
20:54 - 26:22 - All Age Talk: Seek the cross and gain life? Live Origami in church (#firsttime, #newtrick) It's a risky trick with no safety net The trick will help understand the Gospel reading about finding fullness of life Folding the paper to represent different aspects of life - mountain, house, airplane The airplane represents jetting off and enjoying life The tricky part is cutting the paper in half down the middle Unfolding the paper reveals a cross shape - picking up your cross Arranging the cross pieces spells out "life" Following the way of the cross leads to fullness of life The minister's friend Paul Robinson suggested the trick
26:52 - Hymn: R&S 522 From heaven you came (The Servant King)
31:07 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you: Amen,) or there are activities at the back of church.
31:30 - 34:29 - Reading: Mark 14:53-54, 66-72 read by Jeany Bien
34:54 - 37:32 - Hymn: R&S 355 Jesus calls us! O’er the tumult, tune: Cross of Jesus
37:37 - 48:03 - Sermon: Take up your cross The gospel reading is emotional, vivid, and terrifying for the disciples We should try to put ourselves in the disciples' shoes and feel their fear This was the first time Jesus told them he would die and rise again The disciples likely shut down and didn't comprehend or believe Jesus Peter denies Jesus will die, and Jesus rebukes him harshly Jesus challenges the Jewish authorities' corruption and collusion with Rome Jesus asks the disciples to "pick up their cross" - shocking language about a painful death Jesus does not promise an easy life - it will involve suffering We may not be called to Jesus' level of suffering, but our cross will still be difficult Like Peter, we may fail to embrace the cross, but will have repeated chances to try again
WE MAKE OUR RESPONSE
48:30 - 51:29 - Hymn: Trinity Praise 13 – Be Still, for the presence of the Lord
51:33 - Dedication of the Offertory
52:13 - 57:07 - Prayers of Intercession
57:37 - 01:02:25 - Hymn: R&S 530 Living God, your joyful Spirit, tune: Abbots Leigh
01:02:27 - 01:02:50 - Closing blessing
01:03:12 - 01:05:57 - Music after the service
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 18th February 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
09:05 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
09:28 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
11:46 - Call to worship
12:29 - Hymn: R&S 45 Morning has broken
14:32 - 20:44 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
21:24 - 24:39 - Reading: Isaiah 58: 1 – 12 read by Norma Garden
25:44 - 28:32 - Hymn: R&S 85 God in His love for us
28:59 - 30:32 - Readings: Matthew 5: 13 – 20 read by Julia Sparks
30:58 - 33:18 - 1 Corinthians 2: 1 - 16 read by Richard Harding
Hymn: R&S 123 Think of a world
39:04 - 57:10 - Address: followed by time of quiet reflection The story discusses an abandoned lighthouse that was converted by a local artist into a climbing center for youth, shining a symbolic light when they reach the top, as well as a Methodist church that wants to serve its struggling community by offering its building to help distribute secondhand children's clothing and "shine a light" by helping people live better lives even if they don't attend church. The lighthouse was abandoned and there were unsuccessful plans to convert it into a museum, restaurant, or flats. Tam McCarthy had a vision to convert it into a climbing center to help the local youth. Tam was a local artist who became successful and gave back to the community. The climbing center at the lighthouse became very popular and successful. The light at the top of the lighthouse is lit when someone reaches the top, symbolizing their achievement. Many local Methodist churches have closed down and they want to keep their church open. They want to use their building to serve the community even if people don't attend church. An example is allowing a group to distribute secondhand children's clothing from the church. Church activities don't have to directly involve the church, the goal is to help the community. They hope to metaphorically "shine a light" and help people live better lives even if they don't attend church.
57:40 - 59:25 - Hymn: R&S 412 There’s a quiet understanding
59:33 - 01:08:07 - Prayers of Intercession
01:08:27 - Offering prayer
01:09:43 - 01:12:35 - Hymn: R&S 474 Brother, Sister, let me serve you
01:12:36 - 01:12:54 - Closing blessing
01:13:19 - 01:15:06 - Music after the service
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 11th February 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:19 - Entry of the bible
07:39 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
10:47 - Call to worship: verses from Psalm 50 The mighty one, God the Lord, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting. Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth. Our God comes and does not keep silent; before him is a devouring fire and a mighty tempest all around him. He calls to the heavens above and to the earth, that he may judge his people: “Gather to me my faithful ones, who made a covenant with me by sacrifice!” The heavens declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge.
13:12 - Hymn: R&S 373 Lord Jesus Christ, we have come to you
16:25 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
19:30 - 28:49 - Introduction to the theme God's mystery and wonder, focusing on mountaintop experiences like Jesus' transfiguration. Has anyone had any special experiences recently Flowers from the garden like snowdrops that lift the heart after winter. In the transfiguration story, Jesus took his closest disciples Peter, James and John up a mountain. Jesus was transfigured, his clothes shining white, with Moses and Elijah appearing. The disciples were terrified by this divine vision showing Jesus' glory. God's voice affirms Jesus as his Son, saying to listen to him. Like baptism and Jesus' birth, this is a rare moment where heaven meets earth. The transfiguration comes as Jesus heads toward his death, affirming God's plan. We should listen for God's wonder and mystery as we gather in faith. Glimpses of God's divine wonder and mystery in mountaintop spiritual experiences like Jesus' transfiguration, where he was affirmed by Moses, Elijah and God's voice as the beloved Son, and similarly at his baptism and birth.
Readings: 29:40 - 32:31 - 2 Kings 2:1-12 read by Sue 32:46 - 34:21 - Mark 9:2-9 read by Abigail
34:51 - 37:14 - Hymn: R&S 572 Colours of day dawn into the mind
37:49 - 01:00:23 - Address: Christ revealed - followed by time of quiet reflection The readings involve mystery and symbolism, raising questions rather than giving clear answers. The story of Elijah and Elisha - Elisha asks to take on Elijah's spirit before Elijah is taken up to heaven. The story foreshadows Elisha becoming the next prophet and inheriting a "double portion" of Elijah's spirit. There are visions, miracles and God's power in the stories. The Transfiguration shows Jesus' divine nature as well as his humanity. We are all created in God's image and should reflect God's glory in our actions. We can glimpse God's glory in ordinary things like nature, a baby being born, a friend's wisdom. Lent is a time for pause, reflection and prayer as we approach Easter. A smile each day in Lent can spread joy and reflect God's light in us. We need feeding from God's light like solar panels need sunlight.
01:00:49 - 01:03:30 - Hymn: R&S 67 Immortal, Invisible, God only wise (tune: Haresfield)
01:03:32 - 01:10:13 - Prayers of Intersession Response: Lord in your mercy Hear our prayer
01:10:23 - 01:13:34 - Hymn: Christ triumphant
01:13:36 - 01:14:13 - Closing blessing
01:14:36 - 01:19:24 - Music after the service
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 4th February 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe Worship and Communion led by Revd John Mackerness
00:00:00 - Music before the service
04:43 - Entry of the bible
05:06 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
08:55 - Call to worship
09:50 - 12:24 - Hymn: Sing praise to the Lord (R&S 49) Tune: Laudate Dominum)
12:34 - 16:07 - Intro to theme: What makes you feel better when you’re feeling down? What makes people feel better when feeling down, with answers like music and chocolate. Favorite hymns and films that lift their spirits when down. What makes us feel better needs to be the right remedy for the situation. One of the best ways to help people feel better is to care for them and show love. Caring for yourself when a carer TV and radio provide comfort but don't replace real company. Jesus was very concerned for the weak and ill. People were always looking for Jesus, but he would withdraw to pray and recharge. These words can help discover the healing that comes through faith in God. Things that can make people feel better when they are down, from music to care and company, noting that the remedy should fit the need. Jesus' practice of withdrawing from demanding crowds to pray and renew his spirit to serve others.
16:13 - 18:09 - Prayers
18:17 - 21:50 - Hymn: All my hope on God is founded (R&S 586) Tune: Michael
22:10 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you: Amen) or there are activities at back of church.
22:30 - Offering prayer
22:55 - Introduction to the readings
23:27 - 25:02 - Reading: 1 Corinthians 9: 16 – 23 read by Lesley 25:14 - 26:41 - Reading: Mark 1:29-39 read by Ian
26:58 - 30:01 - Hymn: The King of Love my Shepherd is (R&S 552) Tune: Dominus regit me
30:19 - 45:53 - Sermon: “A rich feast” followed by short time of silence The Old Testament and Psalm readings portray God as great, caring for people in exile. The gospel shows Jesus healing and taking time to pray and listen to God. We can experience healing by knowing God loves and cares for us. Paul says preaching the gospel is compelled by God, not something to boast about. Working at the airport learning other ways to share faith. Actions can preach, but words are still needed to share the hope within us. Short conversations can lead to emotional healing by changing perspectives. God still sustains the weak and powerless today through Jesus. We are called to proclaim in word and deed the message of new life in Christ.
45:56 - 49:07 - Prayers of Intercession and The Lord’s Prayer
49:09 - The peace …The peace of the risen Christ be always with you. And also with you. Alleluia!
49:37 - 52:22 - Communion Hymn: Brother, sister, let me serve you (R&S 474) Tune: Servant song
53:24 - 01:04:49 - Communion
01:04:56 - 01:07:34 - Hymn: Christ for the world! We sing (R&S 599) Tune: Moscow
01:08:33 - 01:09:10 - Blessing
01:10:04 - 01:13:26 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 28th January 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications 🔔 when we post new services. - Like our services ❤️ or leave a comment on your favourite ones. 🙏 - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. 🔄
00:00 - Music before the service
03:57 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
04:18 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
06:48 - Call to worship Psalm 111. 1 – 10
08:22 - Hymn - 187 O worship the Lord in the beauty of Holiness
11:32 - 14:44 - Prayer of adoration and confession Lord’s Prayer
15:12 - 16:13 - Reading: Mark 1. 21 – 28 read by Linda Curley
16:20 - 19:53 - Introduction for all ages Fire doors in a care home God as immense
20:03 - 22:46 - Hymn R&S 601 Christ is the world’s true light Tune: 72 Nun danket
22:50 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church.
23:15 - 24:25 - Readings: Revelation 12 vv 1 – 5a read by Alan Yates
24:43 Hymn - R&S 332 Jesus lover of my soul
29:10 - 38:38 - Address Reflecting on school days and strict teachers like the headmaster who also served in church. The Bible passage about Jesus' teaching makes us think about impactful teachers. Jesus taught with authority unlike the rabbis who referenced earlier teachings. Jesus was confident in his identity as God's Son which integrated his character and teaching. We should also be ready to give account of our hope without just appealing to the past. Jesus' words had immediate impact, like healing the man. His message was freedom. Jesus walked the walk, not just talked. We should have integrating words and actions. Jesus earned authority by freeing and helping people, not from any office. We need to know our beloved identity in Christ through baptism and worship. Our everyday words and actions should bring God's kingdom like Jesus did. We are reminded to internalize our Christian identity so that our actions align with our words in bringing positive change, rather than relying solely on past teaching.
39:14 - 42:59 - Hymn - R&S 734 I’ll praise my maker while I’ve breath
43:03 - 48:50 - Prayers of intercession
49:07 - 52:44 - Hymn - R&S 104 Praise my soul the king of heaven
52:45 - 53:06 - Blessing
53:36 - 56:51 - Music after the service

#SundayInspiration #EverySunday

#MoveFromNounToAction #BearBelieveHopeEndure #TheHeartOfLove #TransformedToLoveOthers
#ImmenseGod #PersonalJesus #BibleReadings #GodsGreatness #KnowingGod #FireAndGod #FireAnalogy #JesusExample #VastPower #SchoolDays #StrictTeachers
#BiblePassage #ImpactfulTeachers #JesusAuthority #IntegratedIdentity
#ConfidentCharacter #PastHope #WalkTheWalk #FreeingWords #AlignWordsAndActions #EarnedAuthority #OfficeDoesntCutIt #GodsBelovedChildren #Baptism #Worship #EverydayDifference #KingdomCome #FreedomMessage #ImpactfullTeaching #ChangeAgents

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 21st January 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications 🔔 when we post new services. - Like our services ❤️ or leave a comment on your favourite ones. 🙏 - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. 🔄
00:00:00 - Music before the service 07:43 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
07:53 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
09:37 - Call to worship
10:27 - 12:22 - Hymn - R&S 565 Jesus stand among us
12:25 - Prayer of adoration 14:17 - Lord’s Prayer
15:00 - 28:18 - Introduction for all ages: ‘You’re welcome.’ Material for the week prepared by Christians in Burkina Faso focused on the Good Samaritan parable and loving your neighbor. Burkina Faso is experiencing major unrest and terrorism, with over 2 million displaced people. Links to a couple previously held hostage there that we prayed for. The importance of welcoming others, like Abraham and Sarah showing hospitality to angel visitors. Ways to welcome include providing refreshments and making people comfortable.
28:48 - 30:05 - Reading: Genesis 18:1-8 Good News
WORSHIP SONGS 31:22 - MP 1221 Praise is rising 34:39 - MP 1046 Give thanks to the Lord our God and King
37:50 - Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church.
39:08 - 40:26 - Reading: Psalm 138 NIVUK read by Kitty Bird
40:36 - Prayer of confession with the response Merciful God: forgive and heal us.
44:07 - 46:45 - Reading: Luke 10:25-37 NIVUK read by Larry Ogbewe
47:17 - Hymn - R&S 309 Spirit of the Living God move among us
48:33 - 01:00:32 - Address - The Transforming Power of Love for Neighbour The parable of the Good Samaritan teaches us the meaning of loving our neighbor The Good Samaritan went far beyond what was expected to care for the wounded stranger We should not just pass by those in need but stop and truly help Unity and reconciliation are needed in divided communities like Burkina Faso Christians there are working together across denominations to help displaced people We must have hope - "the moment of reconciliation will come" The command to love God and neighbor matters more than religious laws and debates We must move from seeing "neighbor" as a noun to becoming a neighbor through action We can collaborate to be Good Samaritans addressing desperation in our own communities Love never ends - it bears, believes, hopes and endures all things Jesus' parable of the Good Samaritan, focusing on the Samaritan's loving action towards the wounded stranger. This radical care for neighbor should inspire Christians today, even in divided communities, to work together in reconciliation and service.
01:00:33 - Affirmation of Love (verses from 1 Corinthians 13)
01:03:18 - 01:05:31 - Hymn - R&S 648 Jesu, Jesu fill us with your love
01:05:33 - 01:09:37 - Prayers of intercession with the response Fill us with your love: make us one in you.
01:10:57 - Closing Prayer (from the Daily Prayer for Christian Unity of the Chemin Neuf Community) Lord Jesus, who prayed that all might be one, we pray to you for the unity of all Christians, according to your will, according to your means. May your Spirit enable us to experience the suffering caused by division, to see our sin and to hope beyond all hope. Amen.
01:11:58 - 01:14:02 - Hymn R&S 647 In Christ there is no East or West
01:14:03 - 01:14:28 - Blessing
01:14:55 - 01:18:34 - Music after the service
#Worship #TheMessage #God #Jesus #Christianity #URC #UnitedReformedChurch #Church #Sermon #Preaching #Bible #Gospel #Truth #Scripture #ChurchLife #Praise #Community #Inspiration #Unity #Peace #Hope #Believe #PrayTogether #Congregation #Fellowship #Joy #Spirit #GodIsGood #Faith #Encouragement #Revival #Blessings #GodsWill #SundayService #SundayVibes #SundayWorship #Inspired #Hallelujah #Amen #Alleluia #HourOfPower #Christian

#LoveGodLoveNeighbor #BeyondDebatesToAction #CollaborateAndServe #AddressDesperation
#ParableOfAction #RadicalCareForOthers #InspireReconciliation #HeartOfJesussTeaching

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 7th January 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications 🔔 when we post new services. - Like our services ❤️ or leave a comment on your favourite ones. 🙏 - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. 🔄
Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
Call to worship
HYMN R&S 187 Worship the Lord
Prayer of approach
Introduction for all ages: ‘Well, that’s agreed.’
Prayer ‘Agreement to forgive’ Lord, teach us to pray in spirit and in truth to love as you love us, to forgive as you forgive us, To seek your will and work for your kingdom Of peace and justice, kindness and compassion. Lord, teach us to truly pray: Lord’s Prayer
HYMN R&S 603 Lord for the years
Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church. Introduction to the readings
Reading: Jeremiah 31.31 – 34 NIVUK read by Elsje Hatton
Prayer: ‘Seeking God’s forgiveness’ from Psalm 51 God, in your constant love, have mercy on me, In your great compassion blot out my transgressions. Wash away all my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin. Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me. Do not cast me from your presence or take your Holy Spirit from me. Restore to me the joy of your salvation and grant me a willing spirit, to sustain me. You are God my Saviour, and I will sing of your righteousness. Open my lips, Lord, and my mouth will declare your praise. Glory to God in the highest And peace to his people on earth. Thanks be to God for his love beyond words. Amen.
Reading: John 15. 1 – 10 NIVUK read by Tony Hatton
HYMN R&S 629 Make me a channel of your peace
Short Address
Prayer: ‘Renewing our agreement with God’ Eternal God, Lord of heaven and earth, trusting in your great love for us and for the world, we offer our lives anew to you. We recommit ourselves to walk the Way of Jesus, to seek your will for our lives and for our world, to pray and work for your kingdom of justice and joy. By your Spirit, unite us and renew us, that we may be channels of your love and peace, through Jesus Christ our Saviour and Lord. Amen.
HYMN R&S 108 The love of God is broad like beach
Prayer: ‘Thanksgiving to God’
Distribution of bread
SONG MP 792 You are the vine (sung seated)
Distribution of the wine (non-alcoholic grape juice)
Final prayer
HYMN R&S 463i Now let us from this table rise
Blessing

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 24th December 2023 - Christmas Eve
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
Join us for worship every Sunday #AllAreWelcome
- Subscribe to receive notifications 🔔 when we post new services. - Like our services ❤️ or leave a comment on your favourite ones. 🙏 - Share this video with friends and family to spread the light of God's word. 🔄
00:00:00 - Music before the service
Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
Short time of quiet to prepare for worship
Call to worship – Lighting of the Advent Candles God of hope, come to us again, as we prepare to celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ. May the light of your love be born anew in us.
HYMN R&S 74 Praise to the Lord, the Almighty
Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer Introduction to the theme: ‘Interesting times’
HYMN R&S 274 God is love, his the care
Offering Prayer – offering our thanks, gifts and prayers Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at the back of church.
Introduction to Bible readings
Readings: 2 Samuel 7. 1 – 11 and 16 read by Rosemary Taylor
Luke 1. 26 – 38 read by Kate Yates
HYMN RAS 740 Tell out my soul. (Tune Woodlands)
Sermon (followed by time of quiet reflection)
HYMN R&S 614 Love came down at Christmas
Prayers for us and for the world
HYMN R&S 192 Thou didst leave thy throne
01:02:26 - 01:03:12 - Blessing
